title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Stoneway has the higher money supply in Year 2 and/or does not explain that using the quantity theory of money ( MV=PY MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeOvai aab2dacaqGqbGaaeywaaaa@3D16@ ), since the two nations have the same velocity of money and Stoneway has a higher nominal GDP in Year 2, Stoneway has the higher money supply.

The response states that Stoneway has the higher money supply in Year 2 and explains that using the quantity theory of money ( MV=PY MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeOvai aab2dacaqGqbGaaeywaaaa@3D16@ ), since the two nations have the same velocity of money and Stoneway has a higher nominal GDP in Year 2, Stoneway has the higher money supply.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Stoneway experienced the higher real interest rate and/or does not explain that Stoneway had lower inflation and the real interest rate is equal to the nominal interest rate minus the inflation rate.

The response states that Stoneway experienced the higher real interest rate and explains that Stoneway had lower inflation and the real interest rate is equal to the nominal interest rate minus the inflation rate.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that real GDP in Stoneway will decrease and/or does not explain that actual inflation is greater than expected inflation, which means that the short-run aggregate supply curve will shift to the left (or the short-run Phillips curve will shift to the right) until expected inflation adjusts to actual inflation.

The response states that real GDP in Stoneway will decrease and explains that actual inflation is greater than expected inflation, which means that the short-run aggregate supply curve will shift to the left (or the short-run Phillips curve will shift to the right) until expected inflation adjusts to actual inflation.
